conclusion: Determine which container the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles.
The baffles are the rectangular shapes with red arrows pointing towards them.
Baffles are likely used to control the flow of the liquid.
The liquid flows from A, B, C, and D through the baffles.
The liquid from A flows directly through the baffles and then into container E.
The liquid from B flows through the baffles and then into container F.
The liquid from C flows through the baffles and then into container G.
The liquid from D flows through the baffles and then into container H.
Based on the analysis, the liquid will flow into container E after passing through the baffles.
